name: Bahariya Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous deposit in Egypt's Western Desert, known for diverse dinosaur fossils, including Spinosaurus.

name: Bear Gulch Limestone
description: A Mississippian (Early Carboniferous) formation in Montana, famous for its incredible preservation of ancient fish, sharks, and arthropods.

name: Candeleros Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous deposit in Argentina's Neuquén Basin, a key site for giant carnivores like Giganotosaurus.

name: Chinle Formation
description: A widespread Late Triassic geological unit in the southwestern U.S., famous for its vibrant petrified wood and early dinosaur fossils.

name: Clear Fork Group
description: A series of Permian-age rocks in Texas, known for synapsids (mammal-like reptiles) and early amphibians.

name: Cleveland Shale
description: A Late Devonian unit in Ohio, a lagerstätte famous for the giant armored fish Dunkleosteus.

name: Cloverly Formation
description: An Early Cretaceous unit in Wyoming and Montana, U.S., famous for Deinonychus, a raptor that inspired the Jurassic Park velociraptors.

name: Cynognathus Zone
description: A biozone within the Triassic-age Karoo Supergroup in South Africa, defined by the presence of the early cynodont (mammal-like reptile) Cynognathus.

name: Dakota Formation
description: A widespread Early Cretaceous rock unit in the central U.S., a source of plant and marine invertebrate fossils from an ancient seaway.

name: Dinosaur Park Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous unit in Alberta, Canada, with a vast diversity of dinosaur fossils, including many horned and duck-billed dinosaurs.

name: Djadochta Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous formation in the Gobi Desert of Mongolia, known for spectacular finds of Velociraptor and the 'fighting dinosaurs' fossil.

name: Downton Castle Sandstone
description: A Silurian-Devonian boundary deposit in the UK, known for early fish fossils.

name: Elliot Formation
description: Part of the Karoo Basin in South Africa, this formation is a Late Triassic unit with rich vertebrate fossils.

name: Escuminac Formation
description: A Late Devonian formation in Quebec, Canada, celebrated for its well-preserved fossil fish.

name: Frontier Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous unit in the western U.S., known for marine and terrestrial fossils, including dinosaurs and giant marine reptiles.

name: Ghost Ranch
description: A famous Late Triassic fossil site in New Mexico, renowned for the discovery of hundreds of Coelophysis skeletons.

name: Gosau Group
description: A Late Cretaceous series of deposits in Austria and Germany, with a mix of marine and terrestrial fossils, including dinosaur remains.

name: Hell Creek Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous deposit spanning Montana and the Dakotas, a famous site for the last non-avian dinosaurs, including Tyrannosaurus rex and Triceratops.

name: Horseshoe Canyon Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous unit in Alberta, Canada, known for its diverse dinosaurs, including the pachycephalosaur Dracorex.

name: Hunsrück Slates
description: An Early Devonian formation in Germany, a lagerstätte known for its pyritized fossils of marine animals.

name: Iren Dabasu Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous formation in Inner Mongolia, China, a key site for feathered dinosaurs and early tyrannosaurs.

name: Javelina Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous unit in Texas' Big Bend National Park, a source of dinosaur fossils, including the long-necked Alamosaurus.

name: Joggins Formation
description: A Pennsylvanian (Late Carboniferous) deposit in Nova Scotia, a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its 'fossilized forest.'

name: Karoo Basin
description: A vast sedimentary basin in South Africa, famous for its nearly continuous record of Permian and Triassic fossils.

name: Kayenta Formation
description: An Early Jurassic deposit in the southwestern U.S., notable for early dinosaurs, including the small carnivore Megapnosaurus.

name: Kimmeridge Clay
description: A Late Jurassic marine deposit in southern England, an important source of marine fossils.

name: Kirtland Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous deposit in New Mexico, known for the last dinosaurs of North America.

name: Knollenmergel
description: A Late Triassic rock unit in Germany, known for its dinosaur remains.

name: Lance Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous unit in Wyoming, a contemporary of the Hell Creek Formation, with a similar fauna including T. rex and Triceratops.

name: Lesmahagow Inlier
description: A Silurian-Devonian site in Scotland, an important locality for early arthropod fossils.

name: Lias Formation
description: A general term for Early Jurassic marine deposits in Western Europe, rich in marine reptile and ammonite fossils.

name: Lossiemouth Sandstone
description: A Late Triassic deposit in Scotland with fossils of early reptiles.

name: Lower Lias Formation
description: The lowermost part of the Lias Group, representing the earliest Jurassic marine sediments.

name: Meuse River
description: A river in Western Europe, relevant to the history of paleontology due to early Neanderthal remains found in the region.

name: Morrison Formation
description: A vast Late Jurassic geological unit in the western U.S., one of the most famous dinosaur fossil sites in the world.

name: Navesink Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous marine unit in New Jersey, known for shark teeth and marine reptile fossils.

name: Nemegt Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous formation in the Gobi Desert of Mongolia, known for its large dinosaurs, including Tarbosaurus.

name: Neuquén Basin
description: A large sedimentary basin in Argentina, famous for a series of Late Cretaceous formations with giant dinosaurs.

name: Niobrara Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous unit in the Great Plains, a marine chalk and shale deposit rich in fossils of mosasaurs and pterosaurs.

name: Ocher-Ocher Formation
description: A typo; the correct name is likely Oshurkovo Formation, a Late Cretaceous site in Russia with dinosaur remains.

name: Old Red Sandstone
description: A widespread Devonian-age rock sequence in the UK, known for its terrestrial and freshwater fish fossils.

name: Phosphoria Formation
description: A Permian-age rock unit in the western U.S., notable for its rich phosphate deposits formed in an ancient seaway.

name: Shonisaurus State Park
description: A state park in Nevada, the site of the largest known concentration of the Triassic ichthyosaur Shonisaurus popularis.

name: Solnhofen Limestone
description: A Late Jurassic formation in Germany, a lagerstätte known for delicate fossils, including the first Archaeopteryx.

name: Stairway Sandstone
description: A Mississippian (Early Carboniferous) unit in Arkansas, known for marine invertebrate fossils.

name: Stanton Formation
description: A Missourian (Late Pennsylvanian) limestone unit in the midwestern U.S., a source of marine invertebrate fossils.

name: Ténéré Desert
description: A vast desert region in the Sahara, Niger, known for the 'Dinosaur Graveyard,' a site with numerous dinosaur fossils.

name: Tendaguru Formation
description: A Late Jurassic deposit in Tanzania, East Africa, known for large sauropods like Giraffatitan.

name: Tugulu Group
description: A major Jurassic-Cretaceous geological group in China's Junggar Basin, known for a range of dinosaur fossils.

name: Two Medicine Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous unit in Montana, a key site for understanding dinosaur social behavior due to discoveries of nesting sites and egg clutches.

name: Upper Shaximiao Formation
description: A Middle to Late Jurassic unit in Sichuan, China, with fossils of unique dinosaurs like the large sauropod Mamenchisaurus.

name: Wangshi Formation
description: A Late Cretaceous deposit in Shandong, China, known for its diverse dinosaur fossils, including the giant hadrosaur Shantungosaurus.

name: Wealden Group
description: A series of Early Cretaceous formations in southern England, a source of the first dinosaur fossils discovered.

name: Whitehill Formation
description: A section of the Permian-age Ecca Group in South Africa, noted for marine fossils, and part of the Karoo Basin.

name: Zorzino Limestone
description: A Late Triassic formation in northern Italy, famous for its exceptionally well-preserved fossils of ancient marine life, including early pterosaurs.
